intro: Matelea sugillata, commonly known as the Mexican candle bush, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, lantern-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a waxy texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Matelea sugillata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
